title: AI and biomanufacturing: can India’s policies match its ambitions?
content: When an AI model is used to control a bioreactor, how do we know it’s reliable? Who checks that the data it was trained on is representative of India’s diverse conditions, or that it won’t make a catastrophic error if something unexpected happens? These aren’t just technical questions. They are matters of public trust and safety

content: Odisha is the only State to host the wild populations of all three native species — gharial, saltwater crocodile and mugger

content: Kerala Bird Monitoring Collective, which is organisinf the event along with Kerala Agricultural University, is celebrating a decade of impactful citizen science in bird observation and conservation

title: Order on ceasing bike taxi operations to come into effect from June 16
content: A Division Bench of the High Court, on June 13, upheld a single judge order dated April 2, which had directed all bike taxi services to wind up operations within six weeks

title: Rafael Devers to the Giants?! Grading a shocking blockbuster

title: Red Sox deal All-Star Devers to Giants in stunner
content: The Giants are sending Jordan Hicks, Kyle Harrison, outfield prospect James Tibbs III and pitching prospect Jose Bello to the Red Sox for Rafael Devers.

title: Spaun captures first major title, wins U.S. Open
content: J.J. Spaun, 34, who started Sunday one stroke behind 54-hole leader Sam Burns, survived a terrible start and challenging elements to pull away from the pack and capture his first major title with a two-stroke win in the U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club.

title: Ohtani to return to mound vs. Padres on Monday
content: Shohei Ohtani will make his long-awaited return to pitching Monday night in a matchup against the division-rival San Diego Padres.

title: Grizzlies send Bane to Magic in blockbuster trade
content: The Grizzlies traded Desmond Bane to the Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap.

title: USMNT ends skid, nets 5 in Gold Cup opening win
content: Malik Tillman scored twice as the United States built a three-goal, first-half lead and ended a four-game losing streak by routing Trinidad and Tobago 5-0 on Sunday in a Concacaf Gold Cup opener.

title: Sky's Reese 2nd youngest to record triple-double
content: Angel Reese had 11 points, 11 assists and 13 rebounds for her first career triple-double in the Sky's 78-66 win over the Sun on Sunday.

title: Judge 1-for-12 as NY swept: Got to swing at strikes
content: Aaron Judge blamed himself for swinging at pitches outside the strike zone as the Yankees were swept in a three-game series at the Red Sox.

title: Braves lose, waste Holmes' 15-strikeout effort
content: Atlanta starter Grant Holmes pitched five hitless innings and ended with a career-best 15 strikeouts on Sunday afternoon, but the Braves faltered in the end, dropping a 10-1 decision to the Colorado Rockies, a loss that dropped them to 31-39 this season.

title: ✍  Deals NBA stars should get this summer
content: A $125 million deal for Giddey? Who could give $80 million to Kuminga? See what our resident GM is offering 10 star free agents.

title: How J.J. Spaun battled Oakmont, rain and bad breaks for a U.S. Open title
content: Oakmont was almost unplayable Sunday afternoon in the rain. But in the end, it was exactly what Spaun needed to become one of the unlikeliest U.S. Open champions.

content: Sunday's shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

content: Bayern Munich clobbered an amateur team in the Club World Cup, setting a new all-time record in FIFA competitions.

title: Poch: U.S. needed win after losses, recent 'noise'
content: SAN JOSE, Calif. -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino welcomed the positives vibes from a tournament-opening 5-0 Gold Cup win over Trinidad and Tobago at PayPal Park that snapped a recent four-game losing streak.

title: Delap challenged to earn No. 9 after Chelsea move
content: Enzo Maresca believes Liam Delap has the potential to become England's main striker, but warned the 22-year-old he faces a fight to get into the Chelsea line-up first.

title: Musiala nets hat trick, Bayern hit 10 to start CWC
content: Bayern Munich began their Club World Cup campaign in emphatic fashion with a ruthless 10-0 demolition of Auckland City on Sunday, as Jamal Musiala marked his return from injury with a brilliant second-half hat trick in a commanding team display.

title: PSG 'hungry' to add Club World Cup to UCL win
content: Luis Enrique said his Paris Saint-Germain team are "hungry" to add the Club World Cup to their Champions League success, after beating Atlético Madrid 4-0 in the opening game in Group B.

title: Italy great Gattuso named country's new coach
content: Former midfield great Gennaro Gattuso has been appointed as Italy's new head coach following Luciano Spalletti exit from the national team.

title: Angel City wear shirts supporting 'immigrant city'
content: Angel City, the NWSL team based in Los Angeles, distributed T-shirts to fans on Saturday that proclaimed "Immigrant City Football Club."

title: Cherki eyes Ballon d'Or after Man City transfer
content: Rayan Cherki has said he is hoping that Manchester City can provide the platform to win the Ballon d'Or following his move from Lyon.

title: McLaren feared disharmony, but Norris' contrition will go a long way
content: Sunday was the lowest point of his season so far, but Lando Norris faced the situation with a refreshing honesty not often seen at the top level of motor racing.

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins Cup race at Mexico City
content: Shane van Gisbergen once again mastered a new track to win NASCAR's first Cup Series points-paying race outside the United States in the modern era.

title: Carlota Ciganda takes LPGA Classic; first win in eight years
content: Carlota Ciganda birdied the final two holes to win the Meijer LPGA Classic on Sunday for her first LPGA Tour victory in more than 8 1/2 years.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: Hyderabad-Bound Lufthansa Flight Diverted Over Bomb Threat: Sources
content: A Hyderabad-bound Lufthansa flight made a U-turn and landed back at Frankfurt airport last evening due to a bomb threat, said sources. The bomb threat was received about two hours after the plane took off from Germany for India.

title: Israel-Iran Attack LIVE: Pakistan Will Nuke Israel If It Uses Nuclear Weapon Against Iran, Says Tehran Official
content: Iran-Israel Attack LIVE Updates: The military exchanges worsened between Israel and Iran overnight on Monday as strikes hit residential areas, killing and wounding civilians on both sides.

title: BJP Demands Congress Apology Over "Fake News" On Pak Army Chief
content: The Congress claims that the US had invited Pakistan's army chief General Asim Munir for a military parade hosted by President Donald Trump has landed the party in a huge controversy

title: Tamil Nadu Government To Launch New Mini-Bus Scheme Today
content: The Tamil Nadu government will launch its much-anticipated comprehensive mini-bus scheme on Monday, aiming to enhance last-mile connectivity across the state significantly.

title: Iran Rejects Truce Talks As Israel Pounds Tehran, Sirens Heard In Tel Aviv: 10 Points
content: The fighting between Israel and Iran intensified overnight, as both nations kept up their attacks, killing civilians and raising concern among world leaders that the biggest battle between old enemies could lead to a broad regional conflict.

title: No Structural Audit, Huge Crowd: What Led To Pune Bridge Collapse
content: The number of tourists visiting Kundmala has increased in the last few months. Officials said that every weekend, around eight thousand people were passing through the dilapidated bridge.

title: Tourists Stranded In Israel As Sirens Sound, Missiles Fly, Planes Grounded
content: Woken by air raid sirens, hurrying to bomb shelters, scouring travel sites for escape routes  thousands of tourists in Israel have found their holiday plans upended by the country's conflict with Iran.

title: 3 Iran Guards Intelligence Officers Killed In Israeli Strikes: Report
content: Iranian state media officially confirmed that the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps' intelligence chief, Brigadier General Mohammad Kazemi and his deputy, Hassan Mohaqiq, were killed in an Israeli strike, The Times of Israel reported.

title: Hyderabad-Bound Lufthansa Flight Returns To Frankfurt Mid-Air
content: A Lufthansa flight to Hyderabad was forced to make a U-turn and returned to land back at Frankfurt Airport on Sunday evening after passengers were told it was not given "permission to land" in India.

title: "Get The Job Done": Trump Says Expand Efforts To Deport Illegal Immigrants
content: President Donald Trump on Sunday said efforts to deport people who are illegally in the United States must be expanded, including from cities such as Los Angeles, Chicago and New York, which have seen protests since immigration raids were ramped up.

title: Heavy Rain Expected In Guwahati In Next 2-3 Days: Weather Office
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Sunday has predicted cloudy weather over Guwahati for the coming two-three days, with likelihood of heavy to very heavy rainfall across various parts of the city, official statement said.

title: "He's Enemy Number One": Israeli PM Says Iran Wants To Kill Donald Trump
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday claimed that Iran's Islamic regime had pinpointed US President Donald Trump as a threat to its nuclear program and actively worked to assassinate him.

title: Donald Trump Suggests Iran, Israel Need 'To Fight It Out' To Reach Deal
content: US President Donald Trump on Sunday urged Iran and Israel -- who are locked in an exchange of military strikes -- to "make a deal," but suggested they might need to "fight it out" first.

title: Updates: Ex Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani's Funeral With Full State Honours Today
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani was on the Air India flight 171, belonging to Boeing Dreamliner 787-8 fleet, which crashed on Thursday afternoon within seconds after take-off.

title: Trump Administration Weighs Adding 36 Countries To Travel Ban, Memo Says
content: US President Donald Trump's administration is considering significantly expanding its travel ban by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable.

title: Britain Appoints Blaise Metreweli As First Female Head Of MI6 Spy Agency
content: Britain on Sunday named Blaise Metreweli, a career intelligence officer, as the first female head of the Secret Intelligence Service, the foreign spy service known as MI6.

title: Filmmaker Missing Since Air India Plane Crash, Wife Fears He May Be Ground Victim
content: The family of a filmmaker have submitted DNA samples after he went missing on Thursday and his mobile phone location was last traced to just 700 metres away from the horrific Air India plane crash.

title: Indian Students In Iran Being Moved To Safer Places As Conflict Deepens
content: Indian students in Iran being moved to safer places within the country, says New Delhi as Middle East conflict intensifies

title: Amit Shah Reviews Preparations For Census, Official Notification Today
content: Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday reviewed the preparation for the forthcoming census with Union Home Secretary Govind Mohan and other senior officials here.

title: Israel, Iran Continue To Trade Missile Attacks, Sirens Heard In Jerusalem
content: Israeli skies were streaked with a barrage of Iranian missiles yet again on Sunday amid a spiralling conflict between the two nations.

title: Will discuss with CM on naming metro station after Field Marshal Cariappa, says D.K. Shivakumar
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health .

title: 'Didn't have permit to land': Hyd-bound Lufthansa flight gets bomb threat; forced to return mid-air
content: A Lufthansa flight bound for Hyderabad from Frankfurt was compelled to return to its origin due to a bomb threat received while the aircraft was outside Indian airspace. Initially, passengers were informed that the diversion was due to a denial of landing permission at Hyderabad. Passengers have been provided accommodation and are scheduled to fly out the next morning.

title: Iran fires fresh missiles at Israel; vows further attacks on 'vital targets'
content: Tensions escalate as Israel and Iran exchange missile strikes, defying global calls for de-escalation. Israeli airstrikes inside Iran targeted nuclear and energy sites, resulting in over 230 deaths. Iran retaliated with missile barrages, causing casualties and damage in Israel. Nuclear talks are suspended amidst fears of wider regional conflict, with both sides signaling no immediate end to hostilities.

title: Rain batters Mumbai again: Flight ops hit, commuters stranded
content: Mumbai experienced heavy rainfall on June 16, 2025, with the city area receiving the highest intensity. Wadala recorded the highest rainfall at 161.4 mm, followed by Matunga at 147.55 mm. Bandra in the western suburbs saw 134.59 mm, while Chembur led the eastern suburbs with 111 mm.

title: 'Not slept in 3 days': Fear grips Indian students in Iran amid Israel tensions
content: Amidst escalating Israel-Iran tensions, Indian students in Iran are pleading with the Indian government for evacuation, citing safety concerns due to recent aerial attacks near residential areas. Students describe being jolted awake by explosions and express fear for their survival, especially with restricted airspace complicating their return home.

title: Women’s WC 2025: Ind vs Pak date confirmed; here’s all you need to know
content: India will face Pakistan in Colombo on October 5 during the 2025 Women’s ODI World Cup, hosted by India and Sri Lanka. The marquee clash follows a hybrid model due to political tensions, with Pakistan’s matches held in neutral Sri Lanka.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Vijay Rupani's last rites today; to be held with state honours
content: Preparations are underway to conduct the last rites of former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, who tragically died in a plane crash in Ahmedabad last week. His mortal remains will be handed over to his family in Ahmedabad and then transported to Rajkot for the final rites, which will be performed with full state honors at 5 pm.

title: IND vs ENG: Karun Nair – 'A prominent Indian cricketer advised me to retire'
content: Karun Nair, poised for a Test comeback after eight years, revealed a senior Indian cricketer once urged him to retire for league riches. Defying advice, Nair's domestic dominance and resilience earned him a spot in India’s squad for England Tests.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: To circumvent US AI chip restrictions, Chinese firms are creatively processing data abroad, exemplified by engineers transporting hard drives to Malaysian data centers for AI model training. Southeast Asia is becoming a strategic hub with rapidly expanding data-center capacity, while the Middle East also attracts Chinese AI developers, highlighting the challenges of enforcing US export controls.

title: Uttarakhand chopper crash: Couple let sick teen, her grandmother board first
content: A Maharashtra couple, Pooja and Pravin Mahajan, narrowly escaped a fatal helicopter crash near Kedarnath due to an act of kindness. They allowed a sick teenager and her grandmother to board the helicopter first, inadvertently saving their own lives as the same helicopter crashed minutes after takeoff, killing Pooja's sister, her husband, and their toddler daughter.

title: Jobs in AI era: LinkedIn founder to Gen Z graduates; You will become 'enormously attractive' if...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman encourages young people to embrace AI as a tool for job hunting, viewing them as "AI natives" who can help older professionals adapt.

title: 'Had 70 potential targets': Minnesota shooting suspect arrested; pic released
content: Vance Boelter, 57, has been apprehended in connection with the fatal shooting of Minnesota State Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark. He is also accused of wounding State Senator John A. Hoffman and his wife.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,750; BSE Sensex over 200 points up
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 was above 24,750, BSE Sensex rose over 200 points.

title: ‘Share Bumrah’s workload’; Former India bowling coach Bharat Arun
content: Bharat Arun emphasizes the potential of India's bowling attack for the England tour, highlighting Arshdeep Singh and Akash Deep. He urges bowlers to step up in Bumrah's absence and focus on match-to-match plans, stressing consistency and partnership bowling.

title: Security crackdown: China jails three for leaking unreleased Apple gadget
content: Three Foxconn employees faced prison sentences for leaking iPad 2 design details to Shenzhen MacTop Electronics before its release. In exchange for digital images, MacTop offered money and product discounts, gaining a competitive advantage in accessory production. Apple's aggressive stance on secrecy persists despite ongoing leaks due to its vast supply chain.

title: 'Tears, Test cap, and a big thumbs up' – Dale Steyn's raw reaction goes viral
content: Dale Steyn broke down in tears after South Africa won the World Test Championship, ending their 27-year wait for an ICC title. The iconic pacer proudly showed his old Test cap and called the moment “incredible,” while fighting back emotion on air.

title: UP man tries to kiss snake for reel, gets bitten; in ICU
content: In Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district, a 50-year-old farmer is in critical condition after a snake bit his tongue while he attempted to kiss it for a video. The incident occurred when Jitendra Kumar, reportedly intoxicated, rescued the snake and tried to film a stunt. He is currently in the ICU, with villagers confirming the incident.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‘a free agent’; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendations for the week - check list
content: Stock market recommendations:Motilal Oswal Financial Services recommends Home First Finance and Kaynes as top stock picks for the week starting June 16, 2025. HomeFirst is focusing on emerging states and leveraging technology, expecting lower borrowing costs and NIM expansion. Kaynes Technologies is expanding into high-tech sectors, targeting USD 1 billion revenue by FY28 with significant growth in revenue, EBITDA, and PAT.

title: Shubman Gill discusses Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's captaincy style
content: Ahead of the Test series against England, Shubman Gill reflected on Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's captaincy styles. Gill praised Rohit's aggressive tactics and clear communication, highlighting his ability to be firm yet approachable. He admired Kohli's proactive thinking and adaptability on the field.

title: Pune bridge tragedy: Rust, overcrowding or neglect - What caused the collapse?
content: A tragic bridge collapse in Pune's Maval tehsil, Maharashtra, injured many and left others missing. Preliminary reports suggest the old, rusted bridge gave way due to excessive crowding, despite being intended for pedestrian use only. Rescue operations are underway, and investigations are being conducted into the incident and lack of security.

title: 'Was 700 metres away from site': Filmmaker missing since AI crash
content: A filmmaker's family in New Delhi submitted DNA samples after he disappeared near the Air India crash site in Ahmedabad. His last known location was 700 meters from where the plane crashed shortly after takeoff, killing 270. His wife reported his phone switched off around the time of the crash, and his usual route home was not taken.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Uspe main baithta hun'; Kuldeep takes over Rohit's bus seat
content: Kuldeep Yadav revealed he now occupies Rohit Sharma's seat on the team bus, choosing to sit with Ravindra Jadeja following Sharma's Test retirement and Shubman Gill's captaincy appointment. Kuldeep emphasized his desire to learn from Jadeja, especially with Ashwin's absence.

title: Air India crash: Did electrical failure of B787 cause both engines to fail?
content: Speculations surrounding the AI 171 crash intensify, with a focus on potential electrical system failure in the Boeing 787, which uses electrical systems instead of conventional ones. Pilots are exploring if this contributed after a possible engine failure. While dual engine failures are rare, the 787's reliance on electrical systems prompts scrutiny.

title: ‘Students being relocated’: MEA on ensuring safety of Indians in Iran
content: Amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, India's MEA is closely monitoring the security situation, prioritizing the safety of its citizens. The Indian Embassy in Tehran is actively assisting students, relocating them to safer areas and maintaining contact with community leaders. Following airstrikes and missile exchanges, advisories have been issued, urging Indian nationals to remain vigilant and limit movement.

title: CM Siddaramaiah sandwiched as anti-caste survey agitation brews in Karnataka
content: Karnataka's Congress government faces a dilemma over a new caste survey, sparking discontent among OBCs who fear losing advantages from the un-implemented Kantharaj Commission report, which favored them. Lingayats and Vokkaligas, who opposed the previous report, are planning their own surveys. The government aims to complete the new survey in 90 days, following Congress leadership's directive.

title: Bigger Indus plan: 113km canal to take surplus to Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan
content: India is advancing its Indus water strategy by initiating a feasibility study for a 113 km canal to transfer surplus water from Jammu & Kashmir to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This project aims to fully utilize the eastern rivers and India's allocated share in the western rivers, potentially reducing water flow to Pakistan.

title: 'Sometimes they have to fight it out': Trump says Iran-Israel will fight before peace
content: Amid escalating military strikes between Iran and Israel, US President Donald Trump urged both nations to negotiate a deal, acknowledging potential continued conflict beforehand. Recent clashes mark a dangerous escalation, with direct strikes replacing proxy warfare, raising concerns of a broader Middle East war. Trump hinted at behind-the-scenes efforts towards peace, expressing optimism for a future agreement.

title: Fatty liver: Symptoms and warning signs seen during the night
content: Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease (NAFLD) affects a significant portion of the global population, with prevalence varying by region. Often a silent epidemic, NAFLD can manifest with nocturnal symptoms like excessive night sweats, persistent fatigue, sleep disturbances, and abdominal discomfort. Recognizing these nighttime warning signs is crucial for early detection, management, and potentially reversing the effects of the disease.

title: Liver health: 10 everyday habits that are slowly damaging it without you knowing
content: Beyond alcohol, many daily habits silently harm your liver. Excessive sugar intake, even from seemingly healthy sources, and a sedentary lifestyle contribute to liver damage. Overuse of painkillers, crash diets, and artificial sweeteners also pose risks. Prioritizing hydration, mindful supplement use, stress management, sufficient sleep, and moderate alcohol consumption are crucial for liver health.

title: 'Criminal Justice' S4 E6: Who killed Roshni Saluja? Here’s what netizens decode
content: ‘Criminal Justice’ Season 4 has viewers hooked, with the mystery surrounding Roshni's murder deepening as Episode 6 approaches. Online, fans are actively sharing theories, with Kamala, the maid, and Ira, Dr. Raj's daughter, emerging as prime suspects. Some even suggest a complex conspiracy involving multiple characters, heightening the suspense as the truth remains elusive.

title: Khutbah shaadi: 'Married' without papers, dumped without scruples
content: Hyderabad's Old City sees a rise in undocumented contract marriages. Poor Muslim women are often abandoned without legal recourse. Victims lack proof of marriage, leaving them vulnerable. Decriminalization of adultery and ban on triple talaq contribute to this trend. Marriage bureaus arrange these illegal unions for commission. Women are left with no support after being deserted by their husbands.

title: Pakistan power players keep Imran jailed, shrink political space
content: Imran Khan's prolonged detention in Adiala Jail appears increasingly precarious due to escalating tensions with India, shifting international dynamics, and a domestic power nexus determined to keep him confined. The military's strengthened position and repaired relations with the US have further diminished prospects for his release. Facing numerous legal challenges and a fractured party, Khan's political future remains uncertain.

title: 'Housefull 5' BO collection: Akshay Kumar's film surpasses Rs 150 cr mark
content: Tarun Mansukhani's comedy 'Housefull 5,' starring Akshay Kumar, Abhishek Bachchan, and Riteish Deshmukh, continues its box office reign, crossing ₹150 crore in India within ten days. The film witnessed a significant boost during its second weekend, collecting ₹11 crore on Sunday, June 15, 2025. Its total collection stands at ₹153.

title: Airspace closures, Dreamliner checks trigger delays
content: Airspace closures following the Ahmedabad crash and enhanced Dreamliner checks are causing significant flight delays. Air India faces increased flying times and turnaround times, leading to cancellations. Dubai's air traffic control is overwhelmed, impacting various airlines, including SpiceJet, and leaving passengers stranded, with Dubai Airports issuing advisories about cancellations and delays.

title: NBA rumours: Mavericks eye Pacers star in offseason shake-up; Myles Turner or Mathurin key todeal?
content: The Indiana Pacers are evaluating Myles Turner's future after inconsistent playoff performances, potentially opening the door for a trade. A proposed deal involves the Dallas Mavericks sending Dereck Lively II to Indiana for Bennedict Mathurin. This move could provide the Pacers with a younger, more versatile center, while Dallas would gain a promising scorer to develop.

title: E-Aadhaar: You’ll soon be able to do everything sitting at home, says UIDAI CEO
content: Soon, Indians can share Aadhaar electronically via a QR code-based app, eliminating the need for photocopies. UIDAI plans to accept documents like birth certificates and driving licenses for address updates, reducing fraud and the need to visit Aadhaar centers. CEO Bhuvnesh Kumar announced the new app, enabling most updates from home, excluding biometrics.

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: Not emergency contacts, most flyers had listed own numbers
content: Following the AI 171 crash, authorities faced significant hurdles in notifying families due to a lack of emergency contact information. In a staggering 70% of cases, the only number available was the passenger's, hindering immediate communication. This forced officials to rely on local administrators to locate and inform relatives, causing delays and complicating support efforts during a critical time.

title: Ex-NASA agent debunks UFO theories, says government used them to ‘hide a lot of things’
content: Former NASA agent Joseph Gutheinz dismisses UFO sightings as alien visits, citing vast interstellar distances. He suggests these sightings are likely advanced drones, secret military tech, or government cover-ups to conceal projects from adversaries. Gutheinz urges rational thinking, demanding evidence and suggesting a focus on earthly explanations rather than extraterrestrial speculation.

title: Air India crash: Survivor tried to go back to save brother, says first responder
content: On June 12th at 1.40 pm, Satinder Singh Sandhu of EMRI 108 responded to a loud explosion near Civil Hospital. Arriving quickly, his team aided the injured hostel guard and Ramesh Viswashkumar, the sole survivor who was desperately searching for his brother amidst the chaos. The EMRI 108 team ensured Viswashkumar's safe transport to Civil Hospital.

title: Farmers' stand-off near Manipur's ethnic buffer zone
content: Tensions flared in Manipur as Kuki and Meitei villagers clashed over ploughing rights near Sadu Lampak, along the Imphal East-Kangpokpi border. The dispute arose when a Meitei farmer attempted to cultivate land, leading to objections from Kuki villagers. Minor injuries were reported, and security forces intervened.

title: Uttarakhand chopper crash: No radar, no rules; inside Kedarnath's risky circuit
content: A surge in helicopter accidents, including two fatal crashes, has put Kedarnath's pilgrimage route under scrutiny. Pilots cite unpredictable weather, lack of air traffic control, and pressure to maintain flight schedules as major safety concerns.

title: Jammu and Kashmir: Pakistani infiltrators forced to retreat
content: Pakistani intruders were forced to retreat after Indian Army soldiers opened fire along the Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu & Kashmir’s Rajouri district on Sunday. The incident triggered a brief exchange of fire. Security forces also observed suspicious movement along the LoC in the Poonch district, prompting a thorough combing operation.

title: Shah praise for CM Yogi on hiring record 60k constables 'sans bias'
content: Home Minister Amit Shah lauded Uttar Pradesh's record-breaking police recruitment drive, hiring over 60,000 constables, including a significant number of women. He emphasized the transparency of the selection process, highlighting merit-based appointments and the absence of bias, contrasting it with previous administrations.

title: ISS leaks 'small'; 'not uncommon' to delay launch: Nasa
content: Nasa and Axiom Space delayed the Axiom-4 mission due to leaks in the ISS's Russian module, now deemed "small." Roscosmos is working on repairs, with a possible launch date of June 19. SpaceX has resolved Falcon-9 rocket LOX leak issues. The mission, including India's Shubhanshu Shukla, will proceed once ISS repairs are confirmed.
